intro: Hazardia stenolepis, commonly known as the narrowleaf hazardia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and shrublands. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Hazardia stenolepis is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
